title: Software Engineering Internship
description:
Bessemer Trust is seeking a Software Engineering Intern to join its Application Delivery team. As a Software Engineering Intern, you will have the opportunity to work alongside our talented team of engineers to develop, enhance, and maintain software solutions that drive our wealth management services. This role offers hands-on experience in software development, exposure to cutting-edge technologies, and the chance to contribute to real projects that have a direct impact on the business.



Application Delivery is at the forefront of our firm’s technology innovation, driving the creation and deployment of cutting-edge applications that align with our strategic business goals. Our team is passionate about building high-impact solutions using modern engineering principles and a meticulously crafted application reference architecture. We thrive on collaboration, working together with business leaders, advisors, investment professionals, and other colleagues to deliver solutions that make a tangible difference.



As part of our team, you'll be immersed in a technology ecosystem where your contributions are not just valued, but essential. Our tech stack is diverse and powerful, giving interns the unique opportunity to dive into various technical areas—from crafting intuitive front-end experiences and designing robust APIs to architecting resilient back-end systems and leveraging the latest in cloud computing. Join us and be a part of a team that's shaping the future of wealth management through innovation and excellence.


**The Bessemer Trust Internship Program:**



Our summer internship program offers real world experience working side-by-side with experts from departments and offices across our firm. Working within your designated team, you will manage individual and group projects, interact with senior leaders, and attend a variety of career development sessions. You will also network with fellow interns in-person and virtually, as well as during our intern days held in our New York headquarters.



This 10-week program is designed to mimic the experience of a full-time employee, providing an opportunity to build subject matter expertise and enhance your career at Bessemer and beyond.


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Software Development: Assist in the design, development, and testing of software applications. This includes coding, debugging, and collaborating with team members on software solutions.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams including business analysts, testers and business areas directly to understand requirements and deliver high-quality software.
* Problem Solving: Analyze and troubleshoot software issues, identifying and implementing solutions in a timely manner.
* Code Reviews: Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality, adherence to best practices, and continuous learning.


**Qualifications:**


* Education: Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* Programming Skills: Proficiency in at least one programming language such as Python, Java, C#, or JavaScript.
* Knowledge: Basic understanding of software development principles, data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming.
* Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work with complex technical concepts.
* Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail in all work tasks.
* Knowledge of one or more of the following:
* Web development frameworks (e.g., React or Angular).
* Database systems (e.g., SQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB).
* Version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) is a plus.
* Experience or interest in generative AI technologies is a plus


**What We Offer:**


* Hands-on experience with real-world projects.
* Mentorship and guidance from experienced software engineers.
* Exposure to the financial services industry and wealth management.
* Networking opportunities within the firm.

  


*The hourly rate for this position ranges from $24.00 - $26.00. Hourly rates will vary and will be based on various factors.*



**About Bessemer Trust**  

Bessemer Trust is a leading multifamily office, overseeing more than $200 billion in assets for 3,000 individuals and families of substantial wealth. Its 1,200 employees are singularly focused on private wealth management — disciplined investment management, sophisticated wealth planning, comprehensive family office services, and highly personalized client service.



Established in 1907 as the family office for Annie and Henry Phipps, Bessemer Trust is in its seventh generation of ownership by the Phipps family. As a self-made entrepreneur, Henry Phipps was a founding partner and chief financial officer of Carnegie Steel.



Bessemer Trust retains its original focus as a privately owned and independent wealth manager deeply committed to its mission of providing peace of mind to its clients. Bessemer's adherence to putting clients' interests first, fiduciary mindset, and highly collaborative culture are at the heart of everything the firm does.


**Key Facts**


* For 117 years, Bessemer Trust has operated continuously in a single line of business, independently owned by one family.
* Headquartered in New York’s Rockefeller Center, Bessemer Trust has 22 offices in total. Woodbridge, NJ, is one of the firm’s largest offices, which hosts a wide range of technology and operations professionals. In addition to its sizable presence in New York and Woodbridge, the firm provides client service through offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Delaware, Denver, Garden City, Grand Cayman, Greenwich, Houston, Los Angeles, Miami, Naples, Nevada, Palm Beach, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Stuart, and Washington, D.C.
* To watch a video about Bessemer Trust’s history, click here.
* To learn more about Bessemer Trust, click here.


**About Our Employee Rewards and Benefits**



We provide exceptional rewards and benefits that are among the best in the industry, giving our people access to a wide range of options, including:


* Competitive base salary plus discretionary annual bonus for select positions
* A 401(k) plan with a generous annual profit-sharing contribution
* Personalized development and career opportunities, including tuition reimbursement support
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans with zero contributions for employee coverage
* Employee assistance (EAP) and wellness programs
* Hybrid work environment: 60% in office, 40% remote for most positions
* Paid time off and paid parental leave
* Employer-paid life insurance and short- and long-term disability coverage
* Legal services and financial wellness plans at no cost to employees


*Bessemer Trust is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage candidates of diverse backgrounds to apply.*

title: Core Data Internship
description:
Bessemer Trust is seeking a Core Data Intern to join its Data and Tax Operations team. The Core Data Intern will work closely with members of Bessemer’s operations teams to review, draft and publish internal operational procedures. The intern will participate in design and data mapping exercises as part of a systematic integration approach for upgrading various Department procedure management processes and tools. The intern will learn about Bessemer Trust and our operations teams through this assignment and interactions with colleagues.



Client and Custody Operations manages the following operational activities:


* Facilitating client on-boarding and off-boarding.
* Safekeeping, record keeping and reporting of client assets.
* Ensuring accurate and timely data for asset valuations, account and security maintenance, statement mailing and tax reporting.
* Maintaining a stable control environment for client books and records


**The Bessemer Trust Internship Program:**



Our summer internship program offers real world experience working side-by-side with experts from departments and offices across our firm. Working within your designated team, you will manage individual and group projects, interact with senior leaders, and attend a variety of career development sessions. You will also network with fellow interns in-person and virtually, as well as during our intern days held in our New York headquarters.



This 10-week program is designed to mimic the experience of a full-time employee, providing an opportunity to build subject matter expertise and enhance your career at Bessemer and beyond.


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Work with business leads and management to implement a newly designed procedure management system across multiple departments.
* Review and harmonize procedure formats across various teams to make them cohesive and facilitate adherence to new standards.
* Participate in system acrhitecture design exercises and contribute to metadata input and maintenance inititiaves.
* Assist in enhancing procedure search and filtering capabilities.
* Incorporate procedures into an new procedure management database and create annual review controls to aid future reviews and maintenance.
* Colloborate with colleagues outside of CCO on shared procedure management integration efforts as needed.

**Qualifications:**


* In pursuit of a bachelor’s degree
* Should be initiative-taking and enjoys learning
* Should show ability to write, organize, and publish procedures
* Be proficient in Microsoft Windows/Office, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft Access

  


*The hourly rate for this position ranges from $24.00 - $26.00. Hourly rates will vary and will be based on various factors.*

title: Client Advisor Solutions Internship
description:
Bessemer Trust is seeking a dynamic and analytical individual to join as an intern for the Client Advisor Solutions team. The ideal candidate will possess strong presentation skills, adeptness in working with and manipulating data sets, and a proactive, self-starting attitude.

title: Route Sales Representative (Mobile Sales Rep)
description:
**Company Description**

*The targeted hiring range for this Route Sales Representative position is* ***$18.02 to $23.45 plus commission*** *depending on qualifications; however, the expanded salary range provides opportunities for advancement. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and job location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, competencies, experience, and relevant education, training or a combination of these things plus market demand. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range and benefits for your location during the hiring process.* 

You can find retail jobs just about anywhere. So, why work at Red Wing Shoes? From our purpose-built footwear to our stylishly designed stores, you’ll see the difference. From our life-friendly retail schedules to career advancement, you’ll feel the difference. And, when you create remarkable, in-store experiences for customers who build, shape, and protect the world around them -- you’ll make a difference. We’re not just retail. We are Red Wing.

**Job Description**

**GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB:**

Promote and support our high-quality Red Wing brand image through professional selling, building loyalty and long-lasting relationships with our customers. This is achieved by promoting the Red Wing Shoe Company’s Ultimate Fit Experience (UFX), selling our premium products, and providing conscientious customer service.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Through an approved maintenance facility conduct routine maintenance schedules for the mobile unit
* Perform and maintain daily logbooks, travel tracking and mobile unit inspections as described by the Department of Transportation and Red Wing Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
* Prepare, load, and unload stock to be placed on mobile unit and in warehouse for the day’s business
* Maintain proficiency with product knowledge, technical, and operating standards through continuous learning
* Adhere to all mobile operations as defined in each SOP
* Mobile Operating Expense: inventory, cash, truck maintenance, travel, and other areas that will directly affect the profitability of the mobile unit
* Guide each customer through RWSC’s Ultimate Fit Experience
* Provide appropriate accessory recommendation, educate customers on the benefits of each
* Ensure proper handling of special orders placed during the day’s truck run
* Collaborate with industrial team regarding planning and execution of the day’s truck runs

**OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Willingness to perform additional duties as required
* Maintain safe and healthy work environment by following organization standards and legal regulations
* Uphold Red Wing Shoe Company’s core values
* Maintain the integrity of the Mobile Shoe Showroom, truck signage, and housekeeping standards
* Conduct self-accordance to RWSC policies
* Identify current and future account requirements by establishing personal rapport with key contacts while onsite
* Ensure product and company reputation by complying with federal and state regulations

**Qualifications**

**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:**

* High School Diploma/GED (or equivalent work experience required), and one to three years relevant experience/training
* Enthusiasm, motivation to provide the highest level of customer service.
* Strategic thinking, planning, problem solving
* Team and collaboration orientation
* Effective Written/Verbal Communication
* Computer proficiency

**ADDITIONAL DESIRABLE QUALIFICATION AND COMPETENCIES:**

* Footwear selling experience from a mobile unit
* Retail footwear and/or wholesale experience
* Naturally curious, has passion for new ideas, and looks to drive growth
* Performance driven
* Learning orientation

**REQUIRED LICENSES, CERTIFICATES OR KNOWLEDGE:**

* Valid Driver’s License required
* Ability to pass and stay compliant with DOT requirements, which includes a DOT physical and drug screen**, and you must be 21 years old.**

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

* Lifting 50 pounds, bending/squatting to lace shoes, overhead lifting, twisting, climbing a ladder, standing for long periods of time
* Housekeeping duties including but not limited to: vacuuming, mopping & waxing floors, washing windows, use of disinfectant chemicals, discarding of all trash, maintaining recycling, installing, and maintaining furniture, fixtures, and displays.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**

* Driving or selling shoes from the truck
* Warehouse and Mobile Shoe Truck
* Retail store
* Outside
* Some overnight travel
* Extended travel time

**Additional information**

**Red Wing Shoes is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  
Individuals with disabilities needing assistance in completing an application may call 651-388-8211.

Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP at https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm

All offers of employment are contingent on satisfactory results of a background check.

Red Wing Shoe Company, Inc. is a drug-free workplace.

Red Wing Shoe Company will not be using recruitment agencies or firms to fill this position and we will not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate information. No agency calls please.

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.02 - $23.45 per hour

Expected hours: 35 – 40 per week

Application Question(s):

* Are there any days of the week or times of the day in which you are NOT available to work?
* A typical day in this position would start by driving up to 2 hours to an account, selling boots off the truck, and then driving up to 2 hours back to the store to restock the truck. Is this something you are comfortable with?
* Are you comfortable driving a 26-foot box truck?
* There may be days in which you will need to arrive at the store at 5 AM or may not get done with work until the late evenings. There also is some overnight travel that is required. Are you comfortable with this requirement?

Experience:

* Sales: 1 year (Preferred)
* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)
* Retail: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: REGISTERED NURSE
description:
IVIRMA is seeking a full-time **Registered Nurse (RN)**to join our growing team at our clinic in Basking Ridge, NJ. We are looking for someone for Monday-Friday from 8:30am-4:30pm with rotating weekends/holidays.



This individual will function as a dynamic member of the patient care team, providing treatment, education, and guidance to fertility patients throughout their journey. The Registered Nurse will serve as treatment coordinator and strive to provide every individual an optimal patient experience.


**Responsibilities:**


* Contribute to providers’ effectiveness by identifying patient care issues; provide information and commentary pertinent to patient care plan; recommend possible options and courses of action as appropriate; implement provider directives
* Implement patient diagnostic and clinical treatment plans in accordance with the patient’s identified needs and treatment goals
* Serve as liaison between provider, patient, and interdisciplinary team members to coordinate services. Resolve patient problems and concerns by utilizing multidisciplinary team strategies; Optimize the patient experience.
* Provide care for assigned patients following RMA protocols and standard procedures; apply appropriate workflows; follow charting processes; maintain performance benchmarks
* Establish a compassionate environment by providing emotional and psychological support to patients; comfort patients by anticipating their anxieties and answering questions and concerns
* Provide patient education throughout all aspects of the treatment journey. Set appropriate expectations, educate the patient/couple on available testing and treatments options and RMA processes. Provide supplemental educational resources as appropriate through the Patient Education Hub and other available platforms.
* Follow up on and communicate laboratory values and semen analysis, embryology and genetic results to patients.
* Maintain accurate and timely documentation of patient care services in the EMR system. Ensure documentation meets current legal standards and polices.
* Participate in the orientation of new personnel. Precept and mentor peers. Promote collaborative teamwork. Maintain a cooperative and productive working relationship intra-departmentally as well as inter-departmentally.
* Adapt to changing patient or organizational priorities. Demonstrate ability and willingness to self-motivate, prioritize and change processes to improve effectiveness and efficiency.
* Demonstrate skills and judgment necessary to implement the plan of care, nursing interventions and procedures, as necessary for the care and safety of the patient.
* Assume accountability for quality of care provided.
* Demonstrate ability to manage conflict, stress and multiple simultaneous work demands in an effective and professional manner.
* Continually seek new knowledge and learning pertinent to the treatment of the fertility patient.
* Assist physician with in-office procedures as needed

  


**Requirements:**


* BSN Degree or active RN license without limitations - *required*
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office – *required*
* Flexibility to work weekdays with weekends and rotational holidays - *required*
* Excellent listening/counseling/interpersonal, and communications skills to manage sensitive patient situation properly - *required*
* 2-3 years’ experience as an RN –
* Prior experience in women’s healthcare –*preferred*
* BCLS and/or ACLS and/or IV certification - *preferred*
* High energy, excellent interpersonal and multi-tasking skills, and demonstrated self-directed work ethic – *required*
* Electronic Medical Records (EMR) experience - *preferred*
* Travel to either HQ located in Basking Ridge or satellite offices - *as needed*
	+ *Must travel to BR for weekend/holidays*

title: General Laborer
description:
**JOB SUMMARY**

The Excavation Laborer is responsible for carrying and loading excavation materials for excavators working on projects. Additionally, the Excavation Laborer assists with various labor-related tasks including, but not limited to, excavation, hand-digging with a shovel and project clean up.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Checks daily assignments and coordinates with crew Supervisor
* Assists with excavation needs including the digging of holes and trenches
* Cleans up job sites
* Assists with the loading and unloading of equipment and materials
* Assist with lifting heavy materials such as large bags of concrete

**ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES**

* With proper previous training and/or experience, operates various excavation equipment including mini-excavators, backhoes, drilling/boring machines, jackhammers, and concrete saws
* With valid driver’s license and good driving record, may drive various company vehicles on occasion
* Performs other duties, as needed and when assigned

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Valid driver’s license with good driving record; must provide own transportation to shop or work site each day
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 80 lbs., push and pull up to 80 lbs., and stand or walk for up to eight (8) hours each day
* Must be able to dig/excavate for up to six (6) hours in a day

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Morning shift
* Overtime

Supplemental Pay:

* Overtime pay

Experience:

* laying concrete: 2 years (Preferred)
* excavating: 2 years (Preferred)
* General labor: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Stamford, CT (Required)

title: Financial Risk Management - Trading Book (Counterparty Credit and Market Risk), Manager
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities.  

This position could be located in NY, NC.

  

EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“FSO”) that is dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry, come join our dynamic FSO team!

  

The world’s largest banks, broker-dealers, foreign banking organizations, asset management firms and insurance companies look to us to assist them with their risk and capital management challenges. Traded products continue to be a focus for our clients as a result of broad regulatory changes and ongoing efforts by our clients to improve how they measure, monitor and optimize their risk and capital.

  

The opportunity

  

You’ll be a part of collegiate environment, all about teaming and a “we before I” culture. You’ll help our clients to design and implement strategic and functional changes across risk management, treasury, front office, middle office, and back office activities. In return, you can expect leading-class learning and development tailored to your unique interests and motivations. You can expect to progress and become ready to build a better working world for our people, our clients and the communities that support us.

  

Your key responsibilities

  

Advise and provide clients with strategic recommendations on Financial Services Risk Management issues facing the financial services sector, focusing on the identification, measurement, and management of Traded Products Risk and Capital. Focus on financial risk identification, measurement, mitigation, monitoring and reporting of exposures to interest rate, commodity, equity, credit and foreign exchange movements. Provide strategic and tactical advice on the implementation of legislative and regulatory requirements such as Basel III, Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB), LIBOR transition, Uncleared Margin and Comprehensive Capital Adequacy and Review (CCAR). Manage and motivate teams of professionals with diverse skills and backgrounds. Consistently monitor progress and deliver quality client services. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Maintain long-term client relationships and networks. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Cultivate business development opportunities.

  

To qualify for the role

  

Must have a bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Management, Engineering or a related field and 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate work experience in the Financial Services industry.

  



Alternatively, must have a Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Management, Engineering or a related field and 4 years of work experience in the Financial Services industry.

  

Must have 4 years of experience at a financial institution, a consulting firm, or a combination of both, all of which must be focused on at least one or a combination of the following:

* Capital markets
* Risk management
* Quantitative analytics
* Front office sales and trading
* Front office risk management
* Market risk
* Counterparty credit risk

  

Must have 4 years of experience in at least one or a combination of the following from front office or risk management related functions:


* Risk governance, risk appetite, risk identification, risk monitoring, risk measurements (limits, greeks) and risk reporting;
* Capital management and associated regulatory requirements with Basel III and FRTB, including market risk, counterparty credit risk, credit valuation adjustment (CVA) or stress testing;
* Derivatives product knowledge across asset classes including interest rates, credit, equity, commodity, and FX.

  

Must have 1 year of experience leading a team of professionals on financial services implementation projects within at least one of the following key US and global regulatory issues: Basel III market, counterparty credit, or CVA risk, Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB), SIMM or CCAR.

  



Must have 2 years of experience communicating with and presenting before senior level client employees.

  



Requires domestic and regional travel up to 60% to serve client needs.

  

 Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience.  




**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $131,400 to $240,900. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $157,700 to $273,700. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

  

EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

  

For those living in California, please click here for additional information.

  

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

  

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, select Option 2 for candidate related inquiries, then select Option 1 for candidate queries and finally select Option 2 for candidates with an inquiry which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team (TSS) or email the TSS at ssc.customersupport@ey.com

title: Associate Product Manager
description:
Company Overview:

Fraud.net is a leader in AI-powered enterprise risk management for financial services and digital commerce enterprises worldwide. The cloud-native service helps organizations prevent fraud, money laundering, and other financial crimes and automates customer onboarding and compliance workflows. Fraud.net enables businesses to make safer, smarter, and more profitable decisions. As we continue to expand our offerings and enhance our platform, we are seeking a dynamic and driven Associate Product Manager to join our team.

Position Overview:

We are looking for an Associate Product Manager who will play a crucial role in supporting the development and improvement of Fraud.net's product portfolio. The ideal candidate will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, marketing, sales, and customer support, to contribute to the strategic direction of our fraud prevention solutions. A focus will be on taking an ownership over the Fraud.net AppStore, including maintaining and management of vendors and their apps as well as public facing documentation for releases and user guides.

**Responsibilities:**

Manage and Maintain Vendors and Apps in the AppStore:

* Oversee the relationships with vendors.
* Ensure that all apps meet the company's standards and requirements for inclusion in the AppStore.

Triage New App Requests or Requirements:

* Evaluate new app submissions or updates, determining their potential value and alignment with strategic goals.
* Manage the integration process for approved apps, coordinating between vendors and technical teams.

Create and Manage User Documentation for New Features and Organization by Product:

* Develop comprehensive user manuals and online help documentation for new features.
* Organize documentation by product to simplify user access and improve comprehension.

Create and Manage Demo Data Based on Scenarios Created by Persona Workflows:

* Develop and update demo data that reflects typical user scenarios, assisting in more realistic and effective demonstrations.

Create and Manage Portal Layouts Per ICP (Ideal Customer Profile) and Global Sector:

* Customize portal interfaces and functionalities to meet the needs of different customer segments and global markets.

Create and Manage External Facing Release Notes:

* Prepare and update release notes that communicate changes and updates to users, ensuring clarity and comprehensiveness.

Gather Customer Feedback on Friction Points and Impact of New Features Once Released:

* Conduct surveys, interviews, and review feedback mechanisms to collect data on user satisfaction and areas for improvement.

Competitive Analysis of Product Offerings in Our Space:

* Regularly perform competitive analysis to benchmark against competitors, identifying strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for differentiation.

Collaborate with Product Marketing on Features and Roadmap:

* Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure that all promotional materials accurately reflect the features and benefits of the products.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

* Work closely with product, design, marketing, and sales teams to ensure seamless communication and alignment on product goals and timelines.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, computer science, or a related field.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Familiarity with fraud prevention and detection solutions is a plus.

**Benefits (include but not limited to):**

* Health Insurance
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Commuter Benefits
* Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

**Location:**

We are headquartered in New York City, with staff also located in New Jersey, North Carolina, Washington, and Colorado. We are looking for candidates to join our team based in any of these locations.

* If you're located in New York or New Jersey, we expect a hybrid work arrangement, with 2 days a week in our New York City office.
* If you're located in North Carolina, Washington, or Colorado, you can work remotely. However, we encourage occasional visits to our shared office spaces to collaborate and meet with local team members, ensuring we stay connected.

*Disclaimer:* 

*The advertised pay scale reflects the good faith minimum and maximum salary range for this role. The advertised pay scale is not a promise of a particular wage for any specific employee. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may be dependent on a variety of factors including, but not limited to, the candidate's experience, education, special licensing or qualifications, and other factors.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Analysis skills: 1 year (Required)

title: Associate, Client Service I
description:
At BNY, our culture empowers you to grow and succeed. As a leading global financial services company at the center of the world’s financial system we touch nearly 20% of the world’s investible assets. Every day around the globe, our 50,000+ employees bring the power of their perspective to the table to create solutions with our clients that benefit businesses, communities and people everywhere.


We continue to be a leader in the industry, awarded as a top home for innovators and for creating an inclusive workplace. Through our unique ideas and talents, together we help make money work for the world. This is what #LifeAtBNY is all about.


We’re seeking a future team member for the role of Associate to join our Client Service team. This role is located in Jersey City, NJ or Lake Mary, FL – HYBRID.


In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:


* Works with external clients to resolve day to day issues and direct them to appropriate resources at BNY.
* Supports clients in addressing operational and technical questions or issues and ensuring requests are executed.
* Provides clients information related to BNY products and services representing a limited number of lines of business and geographies and directs them to the appropriate resources, as needed.
* Monitors client inquiries and escalates non-routine or complex issues to the appropriate team member as needed.
Participates in internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the client experience.  
* 

To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:


* Bachelors or equivalent combination or education and experience is required.
* 0-3 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in an operational area and/or client services preferred.
* Client Services experience preferred.
Financial Services experience preferred.  
* 

  

At BNY, our culture speaks for itself. Here’s a few of our awards:


* America’s Most Innovative Companies, Fortune, 2024
* World’s Most Admired Companies, Fortune 2024
* Human Rights Campaign Foundation, Corporate Equality Index, 100% score, 2023-2024
* Best Places to Work for Disability Inclusion , Disability: IN – 100% score, 2023-2024
* “Most Just Companies”, Just Capital and CNBC, 2024
* Dow Jones Sustainability Indices, Top performing company for Sustainability, 2024
Bloomberg’s Gender Equality Index (GEI), 2023  
* 

  

Our Benefits and Rewards:


BNY offers highly competitive compensation, benefits, and wellbeing programs rooted in a strong culture of excellence and our pay-for-performance philosophy. We provide access to flexible global resources and tools for your life’s journey. Focus on your health, foster your personal resilience, and reach your financial goals as a valued member of our team, along with generous paid leaves, including paid volunteer time, that can support you and your family through moments that matter.


BNY is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Underrepresented racial and ethnic groups/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.


BNY assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $46,800 and $78,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNY total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs.
  

This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.


#LI-Hybrid  



  

**BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.**

**Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.**

title: Recruitment, Intake & Enrollment Coordinator (RIE)
description:
**LEAD Charter School**, NJ's first alternative charter high school, seeks an exceptional educational leader to join its community of educators.The mission of LEAD is to enable students ages 16-21 in grades 9-12 in Newark, NJ to master the essential skills crucial for success in postsecondary education, career, and community leadership within a global society. LEAD implements the Opportunity Youth Network (OYN) school model. Key design elements support the unique academic and non-academic needs of students who have disengaged from traditional schooling. The innovative OYN model re-engages young people via active participation in rigorous and relevant content, and standards-driven, competency-based instruction aligned with emerging market demands. Through applied learning opportunities with partner organizations and corporations, LEAD prepares students to compete in the local economy and/or transition to postsecondary education. To learn more about LEAD, please visit .

The RIE Coordinator At LEAD Charter School is often the first staff member to welcome visitors. For this reason, s/he is an invaluable member of our school community. S/he understands the interplay between students, parents, teachers and staff better than most on campus and therefore serves as a constant resource and guide to all. The RIE Coordinator plays critical roles on many teams including, student enrollment, registration, guidance, and operations. The RIE Coordinator serves as a model for all LEAD Charter School students by bringing to life all the values and characteristics needed to educate our future leaders.

**REPORTS TO:** Director of Operations

**Qualifications and Certification**

* Associates degree preferred or relevant experience
* Urban school-based work experience preferred or demonstrated a commitment to closing the achievement gap
* Strong working knowledge of office equipment and computer programs such as Microsoft Office
* Success developing and maintaining relationships with external stakeholders
* Firm commitment to and belief in LEAD Charter School’s mission
* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Demonstrated ability to multitask effectively and prioritize strategically
* Openness to feedback and willingness to take personal responsibility
* Team orientation
* Flexibility under pressure
* Comfort with ambiguity

**Administrative Responsibilities**

* Enthusiastically greet and communicate with the school's stakeholders whether in person, by telephone or through mail correspondence.
* Create and maintain an environment within the Main Office that represents our school culture, is professional, clean, well organized and welcoming to all guests.
* Register new and update returning students demographic information in the school student information system (PowerSchool)
* Provide administrative support for the School Leaders and staff

**Operational Responsibilities**

* The primary responsibility of the RIE Coordinator is to manage the school’s enrollment process in its entirety: recruitment,application, intake, and enrollment to ensure that LEAD meets student enrollment targets in addition to cultivating positive relationships with the community we serve.
* Manage the application, intake, and enrollment process with Serve as a point of contact for prospective students, applicants, and current students
* Collaboratively develop and implement recruitment and marketing strategies along with communication methods to move students through the recruitment process to the point of registration and enrollment
* Review applications and evaluate candidates for enrollment eligibility including conducting interviews, troubleshooting applications, and overseeing and/or coordinating communication with applicants via in-person contact, email, telephone, texting, video-conferencing, and other forms of communication
* Utilize our SIS systems and reports to maintain and track students through the application and enrollment process
* In collaboration with Director of Operations and the operations team, track student engagement trends and make recommendations for engagement campaign
* Maintain a strong knowledge of LEAD Charter School programming and a thorough knowledge and use of the enrollment criteria necessary to guide students through the recruitment, intake, and enrollment process.
* Provide information related to the application and enrollment process, out of district registration process, scheduling advising appointments, as well as other support services available to students
* Work with the operations team to lead engaging and informative tours, open houses, information sessions, presentations to various stakeholders, and events that maximize applicant enthusiasm
* Attend recruitment fairs and community events; prepare materials/staffing as needed
* Assists with conducting NWEA Map Growth testing for students as part of the application process
* Maintain and verify applicant data in PowerSchool by tracking applications process against final enrollment
* Actively engage families during early summer months, per plans created in coordination with the School Leader and Director of Operations
* Collaborate with various staff members to maintain accurate, complete files for each student during the school year and throughout the student enrollment process.
* Team with other staff to complete Home Visits for incoming students and current students if needed.
* Perform other tasks as may be assigned by the School Leaders in a timely manner.

**BENEFITS**

* Paid Time Off *(Personal, Sick, Holidays, School Breaks, Jury Duty, Bereavement)*
* Health Care Plan *(Medical, Dental & Vision)*
* HealthEquity *(Employer paid HRA debit card)*
* 100% Employer Paid Long Term Disability
* 100% Employer Paid Talkspace Access
* NJ Teachers Pension & Annuity Fund (TPAF)
* Metlife Legal Plan & Identity Protection
* Laptop & Supplies for all staff members
* Training & Professional Development

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* School: 1 year (Preferred)

title: After School Group Leader - The Village of Pleasantville (Panther Club)
description:
**Panther Club After-School Group Leader**

The Village of Pleasantville’s Parks & Recreation Department is seeking eligible candidates for their 2024-2025 Panther Club After School Program.

Get paid to PLAY! Panther Club is an after-school program that operates during the school year, **Monday-Friday from 2:30pm-6:00pm.** Staff is expected to supervise a specific elementary grade level of children during games, outdoor play, and homework periods. The ideal candidate will have high-energy, take initiative, and have experience supervising or interacting with children in a day care, camp, after-school, classroom, or similar setting. Additional staff requirements and position duties include:

* Acquiring and maintaining CPR, AED and First Aid certifications and OCFS and NYS mandated trainings (The Village of Pleasantville supports staff in these efforts).
* Fully understanding and respecting OCFS and Village of Pleasantville guidelines for safety and compliance including maintaining 1:10 staff-to-child ratio, keeping attendance and daily occurrence records, maintaining program quality and control at all times, communicating effectively and efficiently with the administrative staff, etc.
* Developing and implementing activities for the program to keep participants moving, enthusiastic, and engaged.
* Be a community ambassador by taking initiative, speaking with parents, facilitating sign-in and sign-out procedures and maintaining a safe space for participants at all times.

MINIMUM ACCEPTABLE TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE: Graduation from high school or possession of a high school equivalency diploma and three (3) years of experience in which the primary function of the position was conducting recreation activities, programs or services.

title: Field Representative - Part Time
description:
**Are you looking for a part-time job that allows you the flexibility to set a schedule that works with your busy life and has unlimited earnings potential? Then join RetailData's growing and diverse Field Representative Team!**

We are seeking individuals to join our team who are self-motivated, detail oriented and most importantly dependable. We have been the leading provider of retail intelligence to the largest retailers in the world for over 30 years and have growing demands for additional Field Representatives to help us to collect critical retail information such as pricing, promotion, and merchandising data.
 

**What will you be doing?**

* On the agreed schedule that you set in partnership with your manager, you will be asked use our company app to record prescribed product information.
* There will be specific criteria that you will be asked to follow to capture information such as item prices, displayed promotions and potentially pictures of product merchandising and/or displays.
* Once you have successfully met the criteria of the project you simply transmit the file electronically to our corporate office for review and packaging to our clients.

**What does RetailData Offer You** ?


* A comprehensive initial training program to ensure you fully understand the expectations of the position.
* Competitive productivity-based compensation that has a guaranteed minimum with unlimited upside as you increase your aptitude and proficiency in completing projects for the company.
* As a part-time team member, you are offered identity theft protection, pet insurance, and 401k with match after 6 months and 750 hours worked.
* Employee stock purchase after 1 year of service.
* Optimized, flexible work schedules that enable a healthy work-life balance.
* Paid drive time and mileage reimbursement.
Opportunities for employee learning and development.  
* 

  

**What Does RetailData Require?**

* At least 18 years of age.
* High school diploma, or equivalent.
* Smartphone with ability to download company pricing app and collect work assignments.
* Valid driver's license, clean driving record, reliable transportation, and valid automobile insurance.
* Reliability to start and finish assignments on time with the detail needed to satisfy the project criteria.
* Ability to stand throughout the work shift and lift up to 40 pounds intermittently.
* Willingness to work in cold temperatures associated with grocery store refrigerator and freezer cases as some projects required collection of items in these store aisles.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: RetailData is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or sexual orientation.

title: Store Scanning Specialist
description:

Come work for an essential business! We put an emphasis on A.R.T = Accountability, Respect, Trust!

title: Photo Digitization Technician
description:
**PHOTO DIGITIZATION TECHNICIAN**

**ABOUT FOTOSTORI**

Fotostori, Inc. is a photo curating company, specializing in capturing and preserving the stories of our clients’ lives. The creation of Ann Sullivan, acclaimed organizer, who’s been streamlining the lives of clients since 1999. Fotostori emerged as a natural outgrowth of the services Ann and her team provide to discerning families, celebrities, and more.

We are seeking a skilled and enthusiastic individual who will join our growing team, bringing experience and expertise to serve our clients’ photo organizing needs. We set out to create a company culture that is rewarding and where there is opportunity for growth.

**POSITION SUMMARY**

* Edit, organize, and preserve client’s photos and memorabilia using industry leading digitization and archival techniques.
* Implement photo organizing systems tailored to meet each client’s needs.
* Tag & assign metadata.
* Use strong memory skills to investigate visual clues when organizing photos.
* Assist with inventorying client materials.
* Curate selections of photos from digital archives.
* Color-correct slides.
* Photograph materials for marketing/social media.
* Facilitate 3rd party digital transfer of video and film.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
* 2-3 years Photo Organizing or related experience.
* Applicants must be technologically savvy; experience with photo sharing programs, macOS and PC operating systems, Adobe Suite (specifically Photoshop and Lightroom Classic), Apple Photos Library, iCloud, Google Photos.
* Aptitude for digital photo organizing with a high-level attention to detail.
* An understanding of analog photographic techniques and IT/Networking.
* Solutions-oriented and collaborative.
* Effectively manage time and multiple projects.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills including effective listening.
* Strong work ethic, positive can-do attitude.
* Job Type: Part-time
* 20+ hours per week, in-office
* Compensation: $27/Hour

**COVER LETTER & RESUME REQUIRED** 

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $27.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 20 per week

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Security Guard
description:
**About Us**

Guardian Adolescent is a part of Guardian Recovery, we are proud to be offering services to help adolescents and their families.

Our mission is to restore the lives of all those suffering with substance use disorders. Long term, our aim is to lead the way in ethical standards, successful outcomes, and client-centric care. We have a caring and inviting work environment with ample opportunities for growth during our expansion.

**Join Our Team**

The primary purpose of a security guard is to ensure the safety of people and property by maintaining a secure environment for our staff and clients. Security guards manage access control by overseeing entry and exit points, preventing unauthorized access. Additionally, they document and report incidents or suspicious activities accurately. Beyond security duties, they also assist and guide visitors and employees, providing a sense of safety and security.

**Requirements**

* **Security background with juveniles strongly preferred**
* Strong observational and communication skills
* Ability to handle high-pressure situations
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Must have two years of continuous sobriety prior to hire, if a recovering alcoholic or drug addict and participating in a self-help program

**Responsibilities**

* Monitor premises and ensure safety
* Conduct regular security checks
* Respond to emergencies and incidents
* Maintain detailed logs and reports
* Assist and guide visitors and employees
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Job Type:** Part-Time/Full-Time

**Pay:** $18-25 per hour

title: Child Care Center Instructional Coach - Lawrenceville, NJ
description:
**Now Hiring a Child Care Center Instructional Coach in Lawrenceville, New Jersey**

As an **early childhood coach**, you feel driven to ensure teachers have the resources, support, and professional development they need to be successful. Your advanced knowledge of child development and early education inspires your colleagues, exciting them to bring their best selves into the classroom every day. **Apply today** to join our team as the **Instructional Coach**!

**Benefits with Bright Horizons Include:**

* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* **Hiring Incentive $1250 Full Time $750 Part Time**
* **Compensation: $52,000 / YRLY**
* 401(k) plan
* Paid time off
* Referral bonus
* Career development and FREE college degrees (for you and your teachers) through our Horizons Teacher Degree Program

**As an Instructional Coach, you will:**

* Ensure implementation of Bright Horizons philosophy and foundational beliefs in all educational practices including curriculum, inclusive and anti-bias education, and instructional practices.
* Provide resources, support, guidance, performance coaching, modeling, training, observation, and feedback to teachers.
* Use education quality tools to assess program and curriculum implementation, developing improvement plans when needed.

**Requirements:**

Candidates must pass required state and company background checks, and meet state and company minimum education and experience requirements:

* Bachelor’s degree in early childhood education or related field highly preferred; Associate degree required with educational plan to complete Bachelor’s degree
* 12 ECE units completed required: Child Development, Child Family Community and 2 curriculum courses. If applying for an Infant or Toddler position the Infant/Toddler class is required as one of the curriculum courses. \\*Transcripts will be required at time of hire.
* At least three years of teaching experience in a high-quality program required, experience working in a NAEYC-accredited center strongly preferred
* At least three years of leadership, mentoring, or coaching experience required

Pursue your passion for early learning. Fulfill your purpose to make a difference for children and families. Explore the possibilities of where a Bright Horizons career can take you – in a workplace committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion where you can be you. Come build a brighter future at one of FORTUNE’s “100 Best Companies to Work For.” Apply today!

Compensation Range: $52,000 / YRLY

The range of compensation listed here or that may be discussed in the interview process is what Bright Horizons in good faith anticipates offering for this job opening. title: Activity Specialist/Teacher - Academic Teacher
description:
**REPORTS TO:** Senior Site Director

**JOB DATES:** Follows School Calendar

**SUMMARY:**  
The Academic Teacher is responsible for implementing and leading engaging academic activities to middle school children in the SONYC after school program. The Academic Teacher would be a **certified Math teacher** that enriches the academic experiences of children in our program and helps them stay interested and do better in school.

**Monday to Thursday 3:30pm-4:30pm**

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Ensure the safety of children
* Able to engage all children in assigned activities, so that no child is left behind
* Develop weekly activity lesson plans in area(s) of specialty
* Ready and prepared to facilitate purposeful activities that foster the development of new skills in children, while reinforcing skills/information previously taught
* Assist in all program activities, which could include supervising children, facilitating dismissal, attending field trips that might be outside of regular hours, hosting special events and other program activities
* Works closely with the Group Leader, engaging them in the lesson plan development
* Attend all meetings, training workshops and special events, which might be after regular hours
* Complete 15 hours of professional development each calendar year
* Conduct self as a positive role model
* Knowledge of DYCD and DOH mandates

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Teaching certification required; college students welcome; college degree preferred
* Minimum of two years experience working with middle school-aged children
* Exceptional group management, problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Competency in youth development and child care
* Ability to create interactive academic and/or enrichment activities that are age-appropriate
* Genuine enthusiasm for developing professional skills through training opportunities and field practice
* Ability to work as part of a team within a school community
* Ability to communicate and work effectively and respectfully with other employees
* Reliable and cooperative

**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:**

* College degree preferred, college students welcome
* Minimum of two years experience working with middle-school-age children

title: Dental Equipment Service Technician - Syracuse
description:
JOB OVERVIEW:
This position is responsible for providing installation and service of equipment in the practitioner’s office. Work closely with experienced technicians and supervisor to develop and improve customer service skills, use provided support tools, learn effective troubleshooting techniques, and increase product knowledge. The goal is to drive service success that improves customer satisfaction, maximizes customer retention and increases profitability.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:* Provides repair and installation services to our customers in a courteous and professional manner.
* Provides and maintains the necessary tools of the trade and have readily available to perform installation and repair services.
* Work independently to complete all on site installation, repair maintenance and test tasks.
* Follow proper troubleshooting steps to diagnose errors on technical problems and determine proper solutions.
* Comprehends customer requirements and make appropriate recommendations to optimize the customer experience.
* Maintains and manages proper levels of inventory in van.
* Produces timely and detailed service reports.
* Attends all required training, which includes but is not limited to Henry Schein Dental Career Development training and specific manufacturer technical training.
* Complies with all OSHA regulations as outlined in the OSHA manual and training. Maintains and utilizes personal protective equipment when needed.
* Communicates in a timely manner to all Team Members and HUB dispatchers, keeping all informed of progress of assignments.
* Completes all work orders in a timely manner. The work order should be reviewed with the customer or a responsible staff member prior to departure. This review should include the time in the office, work performed, parts replaced, and parts to be ordered. All work orders should be closed daily and submitted for billing.
* Submits all job-related paperwork within the required timeframes. This includes but is not limited to FDA Forms, expense reports, and any other required paperwork.
* Complies with all terms of the Fleet Management Policy including maintenance and accident management policies.
* Participates in special projects and performs other duties as required.


SKILL:
Entry level technical professional; learning on the job. Has learned the fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of a particular field of study, not yet the formal application of these concepts, practices, and procedures. Resolve the most routine issues.
COMPLEXITY:
Work on problems of limited scope and impact with no to limited discretion to vary from established procedures. Perform structured work assignments using existing procedures to solve the most routine problems. Follow standard practices and existing procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained. Begin building working relationships internally and externally.
SUPERVISION:
Work under close supervision and receive detailed instruction, guidance and direction on all assignments.
WORK EXPERIENCE:
Typically, 2 or more years of field service experience with demonstrated proficiency, basic mechanical background and customer service background.
PREFERRED EDUCATION:
Typically High School education, vocational training and/or on-the-job training. Associates degree or Technical School Certification is preferred.
GENERAL SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:* Basic troubleshooting skills
* Independent self-starter
* Basic computer skills
* Interpersonal / communication skills
* Professionalism
* Accuracy and detail-orientation


SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:* Working knowledge of hydraulics, mechanical and electrical systems


PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS:
To advance to a new job level, TSM must complete the following:* Level 1 Certifications to be determined by the ROM/ZOM based on business need
* Must begin to cross certify (digital x-ray/software, digital CAD/CAM, etc.)
* Proven ability to administer on time and accurately (work orders, FSRs, Concur, eTime, RMA’s, 2579 reporting, etc.)
* Ability to present preventative maintenance to customers
* Ability to lead installations


Must demonstrate professional behavior and should consistently be at the high-end of meets expectations or consistently exceed expectations.
TRAVEL / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The Equipment Service Technician (EST) position will require the delivery, installation and repair of Equipment involving Henry Schein customers. Technicians will be expected to maneuver large equipment as needed. The physical nature of the position, at times, may require substantial and/or repetitive bending, stopping, lifting and climbing of ladders.
COMPENSATION: The posted range for this position is $42,541 - 74,447 which is the expected starting base salary range for an employee who is new to the role to fully proficient in the role. Many factors go into determining employee pay within the posted range including education, prior experience, training, current skills, certifications, location/labor market, internal equity, etc.
Henry Schein, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants or employees on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability that can be reasonably accommodated without undue hardship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.
For more information about career opportunities at Henry Schein, please visit our website at: www.henryschein.com/careers

title: Warehouse Customer Service
description:
OnTrac is hiring an Operations Assistant Level 1!
  
  

Are you eager to join a dynamic and expanding company where you can both learn and make a meaningful impact? If you possess a strong sense of empathy, enjoy assisting others, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and excel at problem-solving, we encourage you to apply today to connect with a recruiter!
  
  

**Location:** 50 Hartz Way, Suite 1, Secaucus, NJ 07094
  
**Pay:** $16.00 - $20.00 per hour, depending on experience
  
**Shift:** Friday - Monday and Wednesday from 5:30 AM to 2:00 PM (Tuesday and Thursday off); hours subject to change based on the needs of the business.
  
  

**Employment Logistics:**  

This position assists Operations Managers with administrative duties and customer service support. Our Operations Assistants interact with drivers and customers to resolve package discrepancies to ensure on-time delivery and are responsible for accurate data entry into the OnTrac system and verifying deliveries.
  
  

**Unpacking the Benefits:**  

* Competitive individual and group benefits
* Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
* 401(k) with company match
* Safe and clean work environment
* Referral Bonus Program - $500 per referral!


**The Must-Haves:**  

* High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
* One year of related industry experience and/or training in transportation and delivery or an equivalent combination of both education and specific work experience required
* General knowledge or Microsoft Word and Excel Programs
* Excellent Customer Service Skills
* Ability to multitask, self-manage, and work efficiently in stressful situations


**Your Mission in Motion:**  

* Track package deliveries, process and document problem packages, research issues when needed and update OnTrac’s proprietary tracking system for Customers, Customer Service team, and other facilities.
* Assists drivers in the checkout process verifying that all packages are out for delivery. Report missing or not out for delivery packages. Prepare packages to go out for delivery if needed.
* When needed, communicate with customers regarding their package status.
* Research, analyze, and report on daily compliances to management and prepare business reports as needed.


Founded in 1986, OnTrac has evolved into the leading provider of same-day and next-day delivery services in the U.S. for premier e-commerce and product-supply businesses, including five of the largest retailers in the U.S.
  
  

If you are excited to be part of our team and grow with our OnTrac family, we invite you to apply!
  
  

Ontrac is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer
  
  

OnTrac is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, abilities, and experiences. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or age. Join us in our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. If you are excited to be part of our team and contribute to our talent acquisition efforts, we invite you to apply.
  
  

Lasership, Inc. dba OnTrac Final Mile with its affiliates, including OnTrac Logistics, Inc. (collectively, "OnTrac" or the "Company") is an equal opportunity employer.
