title: Business to Business Sales Representative
description:
Are you a dynamic and ambitious individual with a passion for driving business growth and making a real impact in people's lives? Imperity Insurance and Benefits Consulting is seeking a talented Business to Business Sales Representative to join our team and help shape the future of insurance and financial services.

**About Us:**

At Imperity, we're more than just an insurance agency – we're a trusted partner dedicated to providing comprehensive insurance and benefits solutions tailored to the unique needs of our clients. With a focus on innovation, collaboration, and customer-centricity, we empower our team members to thrive in a supportive and inclusive environment.

**The Role:**

As a Business to Business Sales Representative, you will be responsible for identifying and cultivating strategic partnerships with businesses, organizations, and key stakeholders. Your primary objective will be to promote our suite of insurance and benefits products and services, providing tailored solutions to meet the diverse needs of our clients.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Prospect and acquire new business accounts through targeted outreach and networking efforts.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with business owners, decision-makers, and industry influencers.
* Conduct comprehensive needs assessments to understand clients' insurance and benefits requirements.
* Present and recommend appropriate insurance solutions, including life, disability, health, dental, and vision coverage.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless onboarding and support for new clients.
* Stay informed about industry trends, regulatory changes, and competitive offerings to maintain a competitive edge.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in B2B sales, preferably in the insurance or financial services industry.
* Proven track record of exceeding sales targets and driving revenue growth.
* Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Self-motivated and results-oriented with a passion for building and maintaining client relationships.
* Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and evolving business environment.
* Willingness to obtain required licensing (rebate and assistance provided) if not already licensed.
* Candidates must be adaptable to working in-office, remotely, and in the field, ensuring flexibility to accommodate diverse work settings and effectively address client requirements.

**Why Join Imperity:**

* Unlimited earning potential with a competitive commission-based compensation structure.
* Comprehensive training and ongoing support to help you succeed in your role.
* Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
* A collaborative and inclusive culture that values diversity and innovation.
* The satisfaction of making a positive impact by helping clients protect what matters most.

**Ready to Join Our Team?**

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and join a dynamic team dedicated to making a difference, we want to hear from you. Apply now to become a Business to Business Sales Representative at Imperity Insurance and Benefits Consulting and embark on a rewarding journey towards personal and professional growth.

Diagnosing and treatment of responses to actual and/or potential health problems through providing services such as case finding, direct patient care, health teaching, health counseling, supporting and restoring of life and well-being.

Will also communicate with clinical care coordinator/charge nurse regarding patient's condition and tolerance of dialysis treatments.

RN will assist with maintenance of dialysis machinery.

title: Medical Provider (CMA) & Wellness Specialist
description:
**Medical Provider (CMA)/Wellness Specialist**

Do you have a passion for health & wellness and helping others feel their best? Do you enjoy meeting new people? Is EXCELLENT customer service your thing?

ChillRx Cryotherapy Montclair has exciting opportunities for the right applicants! You can apply your medical, spa, skincare, health & science (exercise) background to help others, while working in a high-energy, positive & upbeat environment. We are hiring Wellness Specialists that are CMAs (must be certified).

A Clinical background is preferred, but not required. Our existing team members have experience in all areas of the health & wellness industry: medical assistants, yoga, aesthetics, phlebotomy, acupuncture, massage and more. Will train the right candidate. We are looking for applicants that are very friendly and outgoing - this is the most important aspect of this position. CMA's with experience in giving injections are encouraged to apply!

\\*\\*Please note: we ask that you apply only if you LOVE this industry, are flexible, and can work 1 day of the weekend. Thank you!

Wellness Specialist Responsibilities include:

* Facilitating Cryotherapy and all other wellness treatments including our ChillSkin Face & Neck Treatments, ChillSlim Fat & Cellulite Reduction Treatments and Teeth Whitening Treatments
* Providing orientations to new clients while delivering an exceptional ChillRx client experience
* Utilizing the front desk software to manage the flow of clients; checking in and out
* Handling client issues and concerns with care and understanding and recommending the appropriate treatments - our client's wellness and safety is our top priority
* Maintain the highest standards of cleanliness in all areas of the location - including treatment areas and equipment, laundry

Wellness Specialist/Medical Provider

* · All responsibilities listed above plus:
* · CMA certification required (IM & SubQ injections)
* · Vitamin and Wellness Injections (B12, NAD, Glutathione, Proline, Biotin, etc)
* · Semaglutide/Tirzepatide injections

Here’s what we are looking for in a candidate:

* · Positive attitude and upbeat personality
* · Passionate about health and wellness with a background in the health & sciences field
* · Strong ability to create connections and build relationships with others
* · Punctual, Reliable and a strong team player
* · Loves to clean and takes pride in a neat working environment
* · Self motivated, detail-oriented and proactive
* · Looking for growth opportunities as the business expands

We are currently hiring both full and part time, 20-39 hrs/week

Hourly rate $18-$22, based on experience & credentials

At Chill Cryotherapy in Montclair, NJ we offer drug-free, non-invasive health & wellness treatments. Our main treatment platform is cryotherapy-- whole body and local cryotherapy. We also offer infrared sauna and infrared slim pod. We offer localized fat & cellulite reduction (ChillSlim treatment) and a facial tightening and rejuvenation technique called ChillSkin. We have recently added vitamin & wellness injections and chemical peels, and micro channeling.

To learn more about what we offer please visit our website. www.montclair.chillcryo.net

title: Account Executive - Agencies & Clients
description:
**About Us**



The FT has an uncompromising mission: delivering independent, quality information, news and services to individuals and companies around the globe. It's the cornerstone of our reputation and the heart of our ambitions for the future. But for our people, the FT offers so much more than what we do. FT people come from all kinds of backgrounds and work across a huge range of disciplines and locations, and find an empowering, warm and welcoming culture that values curiosity and rewards inquisitive, ambitious thinking. Those who are willing to unite around our mission and live our values will find plenty to challenge, inspire and interest them. Like the audiences we serve, no two FT people are the same; but together we help our audience be better informed and understand the world around them. It's a job that's never mattered more, and a career that can take you anywhere you want to go.


**Our commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace**



At the FT, we give all employees a voice so that diverse perspectives are heard and valued. We believe that a supportive workplace is one where employees feel they can be themselves at work. We'll continue to remove barriers for all, and in particular barriers facing employees from underrepresented groups.


**The Role / Position Overview**



The US B2B & Agency Sales Team sits within the Global Commercial Team and reports to the VP of Americas. The team is responsible for selling advertising and sponsorships into FT products to US based media agencies for both US and international business. The team generates in excess of $30m across our print and digital offerings.



Understanding the FT's position within the ever more complicated media environment is key to the success of this role. Working closely with our Client Relationship Directors and senior team members, you will be instrumental in establishing cohesive business plans aimed at increasing revenue from our key accounts as well as a strong focus on building new revenue lines via untapped client and agency relationships.



The successful candidate will be able to convince both key and non-key accounts of the merits of the FT's editorial proposition, audience, data points and products through intelligent sales narratives and trading initiatives.The successful candidate will be self-motivated, results driven, and have the capacity to learn new skills and systems.



**Key Responsibilities**


* Working within a combination of a set patch of clients and canvassing new business from a non-endemic perspective, with a responsibility for creating compelling sales stories aimed at providing both clients and agencies with well thought out communication plans utilising the FT's portfolio.
* Implementing client's media plans with accuracy and efficiency while looking at ways in which we can increase the effectiveness of the campaign.
* Building comprehensive action plans that detail the approach to non-core advertising clients
* Negotiating all business on a client by client basis while maintaining strong communication to all collaborators globally.
* Working consultatively with the FT ad ops and campaign management teams
* Establishing meaningful relationships with the Group Directors, strategy, planning teams and buying teams within the area of responsibility and ensuring that they understand the FT's audience profile and portfolio.
* Working with our vast array of syndicated and custom research to create compelling sales stories that should be delivered to key personnel with your patch
* Increasing year on year revenue. Where spend is likely to decrease or stop, an active plan to replace deficits
* Actively chasing incoming and pro-active leads, and challenging leads why FT are not part of those plans.
* Using negotiation skills aimed to maximise the FT's revenue and/or share on all media plans.
* Keeping clients updated on the constantly evolving technical capabilities of the FT and the benefits/opportunities these developments can deliver.


 **Required Skills / Experience**


* Ideally, at least 2 years of advertising sales experience
* Strong digital interest and proficiency
* A successful sales record that demonstrates ability to convert new or re-engage lapsed business
* Ability to work in a team-oriented, group environment
* Excellent technical proficiency in Powerpoint, Excel, and Salesforce
* Ability to use analytics to encourage incremental revenue across campaigns
* Experience in using self-initiative to create new revenue opportunities.


**What's in it for you? Our Benefits**



Our benefits vary depending on location, but we are committed to providing best in class perks across all our offices as well as an inclusive environment to develop your career. Examples of our benefits include; generous annual leave allowances, flexible working (including working from home), health coverage (medical, dental & vision insurance), 401k and company match, enhanced parental packages, and Giving Back opportunities. Full details of our benefits can be found here.


**Further Information**



The FT is committed to providing an inclusive working environment for all. We are an equal opportunities employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best talent regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We also promote flexible working and will consider specific requests around flexibility for all roles where it can be accommodated. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments as part of the application process or to enable you to attend an interview. If you would like to discuss your requirements, or have any questions, please contact a member of our HR team who will be happy to help.



A reasonable estimate of the salary range for this role is $75,000 - $85,000. To ensure pay fairness, the successful candidate will be offered a salary within the estimated salary range based on a number of considerations including but not limited to: skills; experience and training; certifications; and other business and organisational needs. The disclosed range estimate is for our NYC office and has not been adjusted for other locations.

  

#LI-NE1

title: Medical Receptionist

title: Registered Nurse (RN), Livingston, NJ, Full Time, 12.5 hour Shift, 6:30PM-7:30AM (Nights)
description:
**Req #:** 0000166084
  

**Category:** ER Nursing
  

**Status:** Full-Time
  

**Shift:** Night
  

**Facility:** Cooperman Barnabas Medical Center
  

**Department:** Emergency Department
  

**Location:**Cooperman Barnabas Medical Ctr, 94 Old Short Hills Road, Livingston, NJ 07039  

  

**Job Overview:**


We have the finest emergency centers in the nation. Cooperman Barnabas Medical Center has specific service areas for Triage, Pediatric Care, Critical Care, Adult Medical/Surgical and Urgent Care, ensuring focused and dedicated staff, equipment and facilities. The Emergency Department is seeking a Registered Nurse to be part of our skilled and compassionate staff of physicians and nurses.

**Qualifications:**

* A graduate from an accredited school of Nursing
* Baccalaureate or Associate Degree in Nursing

**Required:**

* Current and active New Jersey RN licensure is required.
* Current BLS, ACLS, and PALS, APLS, or ENPC courses are required. BLS (American Heart Association) is required upon hire.
* ACLS upon hire or within 6 months of the start date.
* PALS/APLS/ENPC upon hire or within 1 year of the start date.
* Must be I.V. certified from an approved facility or completion of requirements for I.V. certification within 90 days of hire to unit.
* Completion of all Orientation requirements of Cooperman Barnabas Medical Center.
* Strong critical thinking/assessment skills
* Completion of all Orientation requirements of Cooperman Barnabas Medical Center.
* Successful completion of all Orientation Programs.

**Certifications and Licenses Required:**

* The American Heart Association BLS Certification upon hire
* Active New Jersey Registered Nurse License

**Scheduling Requirements**:

* Night Shift, 6:30PM-7:30AM, 37.5 hours per week, 12.5-hour shift
* Required to work every other weekend and holiday rotation

**Essential Functions:**

* The Registered Nurse provides nursing care in the health care system within the scope of practice defined by the Nurse Practice Act and regulatory standards and assures awareness of ethical standards of practice as defined by the ANA code of ethics.
* The Registered Nurse assures safety in practice and is inclusive of the principles of evidence-based practice by maintaining a realization of their own individual level of knowledge and experience and assumes responsibility for advancing knowledge of self and others in the patient care team by communication with and utilizing resources and programs available.
* The Registered Nurse is responsible for reporting identified safety issues such as hazardous environments (i.e. damaged floors/walls/ceiling tiles/unsecured areas) and medical errors.
* The Registered Nurse is responsible for knowledge of the patient population served.
* The Registered Nurse is responsible for supervising and directing the delegation of tasks to appropriate team members and collaborates with other patient care providers.
* The Registered Nurse is responsible for consistently setting and evaluating priorities through appropriate interventions with measurable outcomes toward improvement.
* The Registered Nurse participates in patient teaching and discharge planning. Participates in unit Performance Improvement evaluation activities.
* The Registered Nurse is an individual practitioner and the interdisciplinary team manager, who utilizes the nursing process to integrate all aspects of the provision of care and individualizes the plan of care to address a specific patient s needs.

**Benefits and Perks:**


At RWJBarnabas Health, our market-competitive Total Rewards package provides comprehensive benefits and resources to support our employees physical, emotional, social, and financial health.

* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Medical and Prescription Drug Insurance
* Dental and Vision Insurance
* Retirement Plans
* Short & Long Term Disability
* Life & Accidental Death Insurance
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
* Wellness Programs
* Voluntary Benefits
* Discounts through our partners, such as NJ Devils, NJ PAC, Verizon, and more!

**Choosing RWJBarnabas Health!**


RWJBarnabas Health is the premier health care destination providing patient-centered, high-quality academic medicine in a compassionate and equitable manner, while delivering best-in-class work experience to every member of the team. We honor and appreciate the privilege of creating and sustaining healthier communities, one person and one community at a time. As the leading academic health system in New Jersey, we advance innovative strategies in high-quality patient care, education, and research to address both the clinical and social determinants of health.


RWJBarnabas Health aims to truly make a unique impact in local communities throughout New Jersey. From vastly improving the health of local residents to creating educational and career opportunities, this combination greatly benefits the state. We understand the growing and evolving needs of residents in New Jersey whether that be enhancing the coordination for treating complex health conditions or improving community health through local programs and education.

  


  

*RWJBarnabas Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer*

title: Insurance Sales Agent
description:
Are you an energetic and motivated individual seeking a career opportunity with limitless earning potential? Do you thrive in an environment where your efforts directly impact the lives of others? Imperity Insurance and Benefits Consulting is searching for driven Insurance Sales Agents to join our team. If you're looking for a chance to work with a multi-generational team in a supportive environment while enjoying the freedom to cultivate meaningful client relationships, then we want to talk to you.

**Position Overview:**

We are currently hiring self-generating Sales Representatives to serve as Insurance Sales Agents. Your focus will be on establishing and nurturing consultative relationships with businesses, business owners, and individual consumers. Your primary objective will be to provide comprehensive insurance and benefits solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each client.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Proactively generate leads and cultivate relationships through networking and outreach efforts.
* Conduct in-person meetings with clients to assess their insurance and benefits requirements.
* Offer expert guidance and recommendations on a range of insurance products, including life, disability, dental, vision, health, and more.
* Collaborate effectively with internal teams to deliver exceptional service and support to clients.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous sales experience, preferably in a B2B setting such as direct sales or account management.
* Demonstrated entrepreneurial drive and ambition.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Willingness to obtain required licensing (rebate and assistance provided) if not already licensed.
* Candidates will need to be able to work in-office, remotely, and in the field, providing flexibility to adapt to various work environments and meet client needs effectively.

**Why Imperity Insurance and Benefits Consulting?**

At Imperity, we're not just selling insurance – we're pioneering the future of the financial industry. Our mission is to empower advisors to serve with purpose, delivering profound value to clients across generations. With us, you'll experience the freedom to shape your own success while creating a meaningful impact on the lives of others. Enjoy unlimited earning potential with a competitive commission-based compensation structure. Join us and embark on a fulfilling journey towards personal and professional growth.

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**

If you're ready to take the next step in your career and unlock your full potential, we encourage you to apply for the role of Insurance Sales Agent at Imperity Insurance and Benefits Consulting. We look forward to hearing from you and exploring how your skills and ambitions align with our team!

title: Cannabis Sales Development Manager
description:
We're building the best accounting business in the Brooklyn area servicing Cannabis Businesses in the tri-state area. That's our objective and you'll be part of that. Wietschner Ziegler, LLP is in search of a highly skilled sales coordinator to join our team and help us continue to grow our business with the right type of clients.

We’re a functional team of high-performing people who are self-motivated and growth-minded. As an ideal candidate, you have a track record of outstanding results and experience in a Sales Coordination role. You’ve previously supported and executed the strategies of the Client Relationship team to raise awareness and drive sales for a company. You’re a motivated professional who thrives on creating a climate of inclusion, trust, and productivity. Ultimately, you are responsible for continuing the success of our marketing efforts — and ushering in a new era of growth at Wietschner Ziegler, LLP.

**POSITION OBJECTIVE** 

The primary role of the Sales Coordinator is to support the Client Relationship Manager in maximizing the business' opportunity for revenue and profits.

A qualified sales coordinator helps our team to sell the products and services that our clients have grown to rely on. A sales coordinator will have a strong understanding of administrative functions and responsibilities of the sales process and support the Client Relationship Manager.

Where the Sales Coordinator performs without a manager, they will excel at generating leads and building relationships and closing deals. The ideal representative is a quick learner with strong negotiating skills and can showcase our offerings in a compelling way. Often tasked with giving presentations, attending networking events, and attending trade shows, it is essential that our sales coordinators be personable and professional.

**Position Specification** 

**Qualifications – Desirable:** Appropriate tertiary qualification. These could include relevant qualifications in management, business and information technology.

**Knowledge, Skills & Experience (Essential):** 3-5 years in sales, proficiency with sales management software and CRM, computer literacy skills including Microsoft suite of products, demonstrated teamwork skills, demonstrated ability to meet strict deadlines, knowledge of and commitment to OH&S and EEO principles, ability to travel at least 25% of the time to networking events and other, ability to manage a busy schedule, ability to demonstrate initiative and innovative thinking, superior organizational skills, strong analytical skills, ability to be effective under pressure, demonstrated experience in negotiating and managing contracts & projects, highly advanced emotional competence with excellent interpersonal and influencing skills with demonstrated success in working effectively with a diverse range of people, ability to recognize & develop strong business networks and deal effectively with sensitive and political situations.

**Knowledge, Skills & Experience (Desirable):** demonstrated results selling via online video conferencing such as zoom, experience in analyzing performance data and projecting future performance, proven success rate at levels above quotas, ability to balance persuasion with professionalism.

**COMPETENCIES REQUIRED** 

The following competencies are required for this position:

**Communication** 

* Excellent communication and client service skills
* Willingness to accept and give constructive feedback for improvement
* Ability to be open and honest

**Teamwork** 

* Ability to perform as part of a team
* Be a team player – offering support and assistance
* Always act in the best interest of the team

**Problem solving** 

* Flexible, positive, ‘can do’ attitude
* Ability to take ownership and make decisions

**Self-Management** 

* Ability to work without supervision and with minimal direction
* Ability to make decisions and take action
* Be accountable and take responsibility

**Planning and organising** 

* High level of time management and organisational skills
* Ability to effectively manage several activities at any time

**Technology** 

* Ability to demonstrate a range of IT skills
* Must be proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint
* Ability to pick up new systems quickly

**Learning** 

* Ability to ask for help when needed
* Be proactive with own learning

**Initiative and enterprise** 

* Ability to use initiative to solve challenges and innovate for continual improvement

**General** 

* Attention to detail and quality control
* Participate and contribute to team meetings
* Always focused on what is best for the business and how we can provide value to our clients and each other

**Organisational relationships/authority** 

**Key Performance Measures**

**Outputs /Key Performance Indicator /Measures**

* Reports - Reports by due date/ COB Friday (weekly) & before 15*th* of month for P&L
* Sales Activity - # of meetings/Weekly targets, pipeline management & meetings booked
* Sales - # of new clients/ New clients won
* Delivery - Completion Date / Projects completed by due date; Deadlines met
* Efficiency - Efficiency/Tasks performed enable Sales team to meet objectives
* Revenue - # new clients and $ value / New clients, services sold

**ORGANISATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS** 

Reports to: Client Relationship Manager, Revenue Manager

Manages: Sales, Relationships

Internal Contacts: Revenue Manager, Business Manager, Chief Executive Officer, Sales Manager, Marketing Manager, Client Relationship Manager, Professional Team, Business Host.

External Contacts: Clients, Suppliers, Associates, Affiliates, Shareholders & Board of Directors, Government.

**ORGANISATIONAL AUTHORITY**

Decisions made in the position: Executive

Decisions referred: Client Relationship Manager, Revenue Manager

* Occupational Health & Safety responsibilities

Employees are responsible and accountable for:

* Compliance with workplace policies and procedures for risk identification, risk assessment and risk control
* Active participation in activities associated with the management of workplace health and safety
* Identification and reporting of health and safety risks, accidents, incidents, injuries and property damage at the workplace
* Correct utilization of appropriate personal protective equipment

**General responsibilities**

* Represent our company’s products and services, starting with a deep and comprehensive understanding and following with consumer research to identify how our solutions meet needs
* Research consumer needs and identify how our solutions meet them
* Achieve company objectives through effective planning, setting sales goals, analyzing performance data, and projecting future performance.
* Meet weekly, monthly, and annual sales quotas through the successful implementation of sales strategies and tactics
* Generate leads and build relationships planning and organizing daily work schedule to call on existing or potential sales partnerships
* Develop and implement territory action plan through comprehensive data analysis, and adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field
* Help to create and execute a strategic sales plan that expands customer base and extends global reach
* Meet with potential clients and grow long-lasting relationships by understanding their needs
* Track, analyze, and communicate key quantitative metrics and business trends as they relate to partner relationships
* Identify knowledge gaps and develop a plan to fulfill them
* Manage month-end and year-end close processes
* Maintain working relationships with existing clients to ensure exceptional service and identification of potential new sales opportunities
* Identify appropriate prospects, set appointments, make effective qualifying sales calls, and manage sales cycle to close new business in all service categories offered
* Possess in-depth product knowledge and be able to conduct demos and relay objection handling
* Prepare professional, complete, concise and accurate reports, proposals, booking packages, and other documentation as required for executive-level presentations
* Achieve sales goals by assessing current client needs and following a defined selling process with potential buyers, often utilizing product demos and presentations
* Coordinate with other sales reps to ensure company quotas and standards are being met, performing market research and regular competitor monitoring

title: Cabinet Maker
description:
Job Overview

We are seeking a skilled Cabinet Maker to join our team. As a Cabinet Maker, you will be responsible for the design, installation, and maintenance of cabinets and other woodworking structures. This is a hands-on role that requires attention to detail, physical stamina, and the ability to work with a variety of materials. If you have a passion for woodworking and are looking for a challenging and rewarding role, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities

- Design and build custom cabinets and other woodworking structures according to clients' specifications.  
- Install and hang doors, including door frames, hardware, and handles.  
- Install and finish cabinetry, including trim, molding, and painting.  
- Read and interpret blueprints and schematics to ensure accurate installation and construction.  
- Conduct restoration work, including plaster repair and mold remediation.  
- Perform remodeling and renovation work, including demolition, construction, and finishing.  
- Collaborate with other members of the team to complete projects on time and to budget.  
- Troubleshoot and repair issues with existing cabinets and woodworking structures.  
- Ensure that all work is completed to a high standard and is in compliance with relevant building codes and regulations.

Experience

- Proven experience as a Cabinet Maker or in a related field.  
- Strong knowledge of woodworking techniques, including cabinetmaking, finishing, and installation.  
- Experience with restoration and remodeling projects, including mold remediation and plaster repair.  
- Ability to read and interpret blueprints, schematics, and other technical documents.  
- Familiarity with safety protocols and best practices for working with power tools and other equipment.  
- Physical stamina and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Skills

- Proficiency in cabinet installation and door hanging.  
- Knowledge of the restoration industry and mold remediation techniques.  
- Ability to read and interpret blueprints and schematics.  
- Experience with plaster and installation.  
- Strong skills in remodeling and renovation work.  
- Ability to work effectively with a variety of materials, including wood, metal, and plastic.  
- Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.

title: Addiction Medicine APP
description:
**Job description**

Addiction Medicine, Full Time Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant

Schedule: 7 shifts every 2 weeks, alternating weekends; other scheduling options.

Seeking full-time Physician Assistant or Nurse Practitioner with previous addiction experience in MAT and the treatment of substance use disorders (SUD). This position is a full-time position, with rotating daytime shifts. There is the opportunity to pick up additional overtime hours as desired.

The field of addiction medicine is growing and this position will enable you to gain experience providing wide-ranging treatment in the area of addiction medicine, including MAT, as a member of our inpatient and outpatient detoxification and rehabilitation team.

The right candidate will have an opportunity to work with a committed team of professionals to provide linkage and increased access to evidence-based SUD treatments.

Buprenorphine experience in the inpatient and outpatient setting is preferred.Inpatient and/or outpatient detoxification/rehabilitation is preferred.

* Assessment and management of candidates presenting with substance use disorders.
* Coordinate patients’ progress and treatment plans with an active multi-disciplinary team including counselors, nursing, and psychiatrists.

title: Office Manager/HR Manager
description:
**Job Title: Office Manager/HR Manager**

**Location:** Living Well Balanced, Upper West Side, NYC

**About Us:**

Living Well Balanced is a renowned wellness center dedicated to the Upper West Side community for over 20 years. We offer a range of services, including Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Massage Therapy, Chiropractic, Personal Training, Stretching, and Rock Steady Boxing. Our mission is to provide a collaborative, holistic, and personalized approach to wellness. We are seeking a dedicated and dynamic Office Manager/HR Manager to join our growing team and contribute to our mission of promoting health and wellness in the workplace.

**Position Overview:**

We are looking for a passionate Office Manager/HR Manager with a strong background in both office management and HR management. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about fostering a positive work culture, improving employee engagement, and supporting organizational growth. You will play a crucial role in implementing HR policies, managing office operations, and enhancing the overall success of our organization.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Strategic HR Planning:** Collaborate with departments to develop and execute HR strategies that align with organizational goals and support overall business objectives.
* **Onboarding Excellence:** Manage and refine the onboarding process to ensure new hires are effectively integrated into their roles and the company culture.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with managers to foster a supportive, collaborative work environment.
* **Conflict Resolution:** Address and resolve workplace conflicts using professional mediation and effective problem-solving techniques.
* **Employee Relations:** Handle workplace investigations, disciplinary actions, and terminations with fairness, confidentiality, and compliance.
* **Administrative Duties:** Oversee employee data management, attendance tracking, PTO, payroll processing, and maintenance of HR systems.
* **Performance Management:** Conduct interviews and performance reviews, providing guidance to support employee development and organizational goals.
* **Confidentiality:** Maintain strict confidentiality regarding sensitive employee information and workplace matters.
* **HR Reporting:** Provide regular HR updates to stakeholders to keep them informed of developments and metrics.
* **Benefits Administration:** Act as the primary contact for employee benefits (medical, dental, vision), lead benefits presentations, manage enrollment processes, and ensure accurate benefits administration.
* **Policy Support:** Address employee inquiries about company policies and the employee handbook, providing clear and accurate information.
* **Talent Acquisition Support:** Assist with recruitment and onboarding tasks, including job postings, applicant screening, interview coordination, and new hire paperwork.
* **Project Management:** Manage various projects and processes such as salary and bonus reviews, employee engagement initiatives, and ad-hoc projects.
* **Training and Development:** Collaborate with management to assess development needs, deliver training, and support career development.
* **Office Management:** Engage with internal clients to understand business operations and staffing needs, and work with management to develop and implement policies and initiatives.
* **File Maintenance:** Oversee the organization and maintenance of the HR department’s electronic filing system and documentation.
* **Problem Solving:** Utilize critical thinking and problem-solving skills to address challenges and adapt to evolving situations.
* **Communication Skills:** Exhibit exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively interact with employees and convey information clearly.
* **Regulatory Knowledge:** Interpret and apply HR laws and policies to ensure compliance and adherence to best practices.

**Key Requirements:**

* **Experience:** Minimum 2-3 years of experience as an Office Manager and/or HR Manager, preferably in a medical or wellness setting.
* **Skills:**
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in problem-solving, conflict resolution, and disciplinary processes.
* Experience with payroll systems and a solid understanding of HR laws.
* Competency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook).
* **Personal Attributes:**
* Hands-on, self-motivated, and able to work independently as well as in a team.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to thrive under pressure.
* Proven track record of effective collaboration with leadership.
* High energy, flexible, and capable of managing both operational and strategic tasks.
* A person of sound judgment, able to establish credibility and act as a trusted advisor to management.

Pay: $25.00 - $35.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35-40 per week

**Competitive benefits**

We offer incentives to reward your hard work!

Some examples may include:

· Additional PTO days

· Free lunch and/or dinner

· Up to $600 gift cards (Visa, Amazon etc.)

· Complimentary in-house services (Massage, physical therapy, personal training etc.)

* 401(k)
* Health, dental, vision coverage with Employer contribution
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health savings account
* Holiday pay
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

And more!

**How to Apply:**

If you are an enthusiastic professional with a passion for fostering a positive workplace and promoting health and wellness, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and how you align with our mission at Living Well Balanced.

Join our team and make a meaningful impact on our community and employees!

title: Retail Sales Representative - Stamford, CT
description:
**What We Do**



At C.A. Fortune, we aspire to maintain our position as the nation's leading consumer brands agency. We realize how fortunate we are (pun intended) to offer comprehensive solutions to our clients. From sales management to marketing, all the way down to insights and e-commerce, our boutique service model offers a breadth of services to our clients.


**Who We Are**



People. Passion. Purpose. Our people are the core of our business. Our unique boutique service model allows our people to follow their passions with a purpose, all while delivering excellent services to our clients. We are committed to living out our values. We are fearless and curious innovators who lead with solutions, empower others, and do the right thing, always. We are a family-first organization and recognize the importance of a healthy and flexible work-life balance, a positive support system, and the power of diversity and inclusion.


**Overview of the Role**


* The Retail Sales Representative will properly manage their assigned territory by completing store visits, surveys, and tasks. They will have the ability to take pictures and complete reporting requirements with provided technology. This position will require light merchandising and the ability to bend and lift 25 pounds.
* Location: Stamford, CT ( must live within a 25 mile radius)
* This position is **full-time** 37-40 hours/ week
* Compensation: $19-20 hourly
* Working hours: 7am - 3pm
* You will be responsible for selling, merchandising, gaining/maintaining distribution within a variety of accounts
* Utilize technology to complete work efficiently
* You must be able to lift, bend/stoop for extended periods of time
* This is a position where you work independently, follow direction, and have excellent communication skills


**What You'll Do at C.A.** **Fortune**


* Retail work will entail (but not limited to) ordering product, working product to shelves from new orders, etc.
* Conduct audits and very light merchandising in area grocery stores
* Drive to various retail locations
* Verify that our clients' products are accurately represented on store shelves
* Report findings and data to management thru downloaded app
* Maintain a safe working environment while working in the stores
* Adhere to attendance and dress code guidelines
* Must be able to perform physical activities, i.e., frequent standing, walking, bending, squatting, lifting, etc. Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds
* Comply with any additional guidelines established by the Store Team


**What You Should Bring to the Table**


* High School Diploma
* Reliable transportation
* Valid Driver License
* Proof of Automobile insurance
* Reliable phone (at least 5 years old) service and internet service for daily communication.
* Required to drive to stores in assigned territory to complete retail task & audits at local grocery retailer.


**Perks**


* Paid drive time
* Flexible monthly schedule
* No heavy lifting required
* 16 days of PTO
* 11 paid company holidays per year
* 2 paid volunteer days per year
* 3 months fully paid parental leave (regardless of gender)
* Medical, dental, and vision
* Paid company life insurance
* 401k with company match

  


**Come As You Are**



C.A. is committed to making our company more inclusive. Diversity fuels our innovation and better connects us to our clients, our colleagues, and our communities. Based on research, we know that women and other marginalized groups tend to apply to roles only when their experience perfectly matches the job description. That said, we encourage you to apply if you meet the majority of qualifications, especially if this role aligns with your career trajectory.

title: Team Leader - Marrick
description:
**Job Summary:**



We are seeking a motivated and energetic Team Leader for our Chip City retail store. As the Team Leader, you will play a key role in ensuring the smooth operation of our store and leading a team of enthusiastic counter staff to deliver high-quality service to our customers. Your primary responsibilities will include overseeing schedules, guiding counter staff, maintaining quality standards, and fostering a positive work environment. At Chip City, our team is all about being Courteous, Happy, Informative, and Precise.


**Responsibilities:**


* Lead and motivate a team of counter staff to achieve sales goals, deliver an engaging experience, and promote loyalty programs, while maintaining quality standards.
* Handle various store administration tasks including scheduling, payroll verification, ensuring compliance with meal break regulations, and managing bank deposits.
* Coordinate and assign tasks to counter staff to ensure efficient workflow and optimal use of resources.
* Oversee the baking process to ensure compliance with recipes, portion sizes, and quality guidelines.
* Train new counter staff on baking techniques, safety procedures, and company policies.
* Monitor inventory levels and place orders for cookies and supplies as needed.
* Conduct regular inspections of equipment and work areas to ensure cleanliness, safety, and compliance with sanitation standards.
* Address any issues or concerns raised by counter staff and partner with upper management to provide coaching and support as needed.
* Uphold a positive and inclusive work environment by promoting teamwork, open communication, and mutual respect among counter staff.


**Qualifications:**


* Proven experience working in a cafe or bakery setting, with at least 1 year in a leadership or supervisory role.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively motivate and coach team members.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.
* Detail-oriented with a focus on maintaining quality and consistency in product output.
* Understanding of food safety regulations and willingness to enforce sanitation standards.
* Food Protection Certification preferred or willingness to obtain (where required).
* Flexibility to work mornings, nights, weekends, and holidays as needed.
* High school diploma or equivalent; additional culinary or management training is a plus.
* Successful completion of on-the-job training.


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to navigate a bakery, stockroom, and office spaces, with the capability to lift up to 30 lbs., with or without reasonable accommodation.
* Capability to work in a commercial oven's high-temperature environment.
* Ability to withstand extended periods of standing.


**Benefits + Perks:**


* Eligible for Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), and Commuter benefits.
* A complimentary Chip City cookie and beverage during each shift.
* 50% Off Employee Discount.
* Unleash your career growth as Chip City rapidly grows!


**Pay Range:** $23.00 - $25.00 per hour
company_description: The East Coast’s most beloved and fastest-growing cookie bakeries!

title: Care Manager, RN
description:
***CAREER OFFERING PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL FULFILLMENT*****!**

Since 1920, CenterLight Healthcare, Inc. has provided exceptional, high-quality homecare for patients in the New York metropolitan area. CenterLight Health System offers residential and community-based services. At CenterLight Healthcare, we embrace the values of integrity, caring, diversity and creativity through everything we do. If you are a team player with similar values and are looking to grow in your career, we are looking to invest in you.

***We seek talented professionals from diverse backgrounds and sectors that want to make a difference!***

Responsible for supporting the nursing standards of excellence with advanced professional education to deliver high-quality care. Serve the organization as a member of the management team, working alongside all departments and employees to support and oversee the day-to-day operations. Provide guidance, and deliver best practices in achieving the organization's objectives, goals, and mission. Cultivate an environment dedicated to improving experience, enhancing satisfaction and retention. Provides care coordination in a manner that is sensitive to age, gender, sexual orientation, cultural, linguistic, racial, ethnic, religious backgrounds, and congenital or acquired disabilities.

**The ideal candidate will be responsible for:** 

· Review and ensure effective development and execution of personalized care plans that result in improved satisfaction & outcomes for all participants.

· Facilitate and complete the process of Interdisciplinary Team (IDT) meetings, Service Delivery Requests (SDR), and other meetings. This includes completing the attestations as needed. Support and collaborate with the Virtual IDT as needed.

· Serve as a manager on call during non-operational hours of the physical sites and was responsible for follow-ups, including follow-up documentation and initiating grievances on participant’s/caregivers’ behalf in a timely manner.

· Responsible for running necessary Clinical Delivery reports.

· Participates and represents the Community Health Nurse (CHN) in IDT meetings, when required.

· Balance and allocate staffing and related resources throughout the site and ensure adequate team assignments and coverage as a seamless operation.

· Responsible for ongoing communication with IDT and necessary parties involved to coordinate care consistent with the participant’s health care needs and goals to support in attaining and maintaining optimal health status.

· Collaborate with clinicians to review UAS and the UAS analyzer system to ensure the accuracy of their assessments.

· Ensure all incidents are investigated and addressed accordingly. Ensure Level 2 investigation and documentation are completed in a timely manner according to the CLHC regulation.

· Ensure documentation for participants is complete, and accurate, including and not limited to enrollment, disenrollment, electronic/paper medical record, and any other clinical notes.

· Review participant’s charts for quality and address any deficiencies.

· In collaboration with the Transitions in Care Team, provide care management services across sites and communicate with appropriate team members, facility, discharge planner, and home care coordinator when members are transitioned between care settings.

· Coordinates, facilitates, and arranges for long-term care services in nursing homes, rehab facilities, etc., as needed

· Monitor care management activities, services, and members’ responses to interventions to determine the effectiveness of the plan of care and the utilization of services and implements changes and adjustments to meet needs and goals.

· Ensure documentations are in accordance with CLHC standards and federal/state regulations

· Maintain up-to-date knowledge about current health-related issues, procedures, evidence-based clinical practices guidelines, medications, and impacting health and practice standards.

· Recommend and contribute to improvements in services, programs, policies, and procedures to ensure optimum care and services to members.

· Collaborate with Human Resources Department (HR) in conducting Interviews, coaching, and disciplinary action if needed. Assist in onboarding and professional development training of staff to ensure compliance with policies/procedures/regulations, as well as developing a continuous learning environment focused on growth and continued advancement. Ensures appropriate regulatory compliance is effective and being met at all federal and state levels.

· Evaluates the work performance and competency of direct reports. This includes ongoing informal feedback/counseling/support and completion of annual performance reviews.

· Ensures that direct reports conduct their duties according to applicable rules and regulations as well as the organization’s policies and procedures

· Investigate and resolve employee grievances and complaints.

· Serve as the Director of Patient Services (DPS) for the LHCSA, as assigned.

· All other duties as assigned.

**Weekly Hours**: 37.5 hours

**Schedule:** 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM

**Locations:** CLHC Bronx NY - Wallerstein (PACE Center)

**The candidate we seek must possess:**

· Degree from an NLN accredited nursing school (RN, BSN required or at least 5 years’ experience in health care setting).

· Successful completion of an accredited Nursing Program is required.

· A Baccalaureate degree is highly desired.

· Completed NYSED-approved infection control coursework.

· A minimum of 8.0 education contact hours may include contact hours of mandatory training requirements such as infection control coursework.

· Case Management Certification recommended within 2 years of the employment

· Minimum of 2 years of administrative experience in a management capacity in a certified home health agency (CHHA), long-term home health care (LHCSA), acute care, medical-surgical, and/or critical care, nursing home experience, diagnostic & treatment clinic preferred.

· Customer Service experience is required.

· Managed long-term care insurance experience beneficial.

· Minimum of 1-year experience working with the elderly

· Supervisory experience is required.

· Current active and unrestricted license and registration in New York State required as a Registered Nurse.

· **Korean Bilingual** 

**The physical requirements of the ideal candidate:**

Individuals must be able to sustain certain physical requirements essential to the job. This includes, but is not limited to:

· Standing - Duration of up to 8 hours per day in the field/community

· Sitting/Stationary positions – Sedentary position for a duration of up to 6-8 hours a day for consecutive hours/periods.

· Lifting/Push/Pull – Up to 50 pounds of equipment, baggage, supplies, and other items used in the scope of the job using OSHA guidelines, etc.

· Bending/Squatting – Must be able to safely bend or squat to perform the essential functions under the scope of the job.

· Stairs/Steps/Walking/Climbing – must be able to safely maneuver stairs, climb up/down, and walk to access work areas. The position requires the individual to be able to travel and walk between sites/locations and work areas throughout the day.

· Agility/Fine Motor Skills - Must demonstrate agility and fine motor skills to operate and activate equipment, devices, instruments, and tools to complete essential job functions (ie. typing, use of supplies, equipment, etc.)

· Sight/Visual Requirements – Must be able to visually read documentation, papers, orders, signs, etc., and type/write documentation, etc. with accuracy.

· Audio Hearing and Motor Skills (language) Requirements – Must be able to listen attentively and document information from patients, community members, co-workers, clients, providers, etc., and intake information through audio processing with accuracy. In addition, must be able to speak comfortably and clearly with language motor skills for customers to understand the individual.

· Cognitive Ability – Must be able to demonstrate good decision-making, reasonableness, cognitive ability, rational processing, and analysis to satisfy essential functions of the job.

CenterLight Healthcare Inc.

Care and compassion for generations, serving the New York Community for more than 90 years!

We are an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, height, weight, or genetic information. We are committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities.

title: Cashier
description:
* **Cashier**

**Job Summary:**

To deliver a great experience to every customer while providing accurate, friendly and efficient checkout service; to accurately scan, price and bag products; to collect proper payment, and to provide proper change if necessary.

**Required Qualifications:**

The minimum required qualifications for this position include, but are not limited to, the following:

* Ability to proficiently read, write, speak, analyze, interpret, and understand the English language.
* Ability to perform basic math.
* Ability to stand/walk for the duration of a scheduled shift.
* Ability to stand, bend, twist, reach, push, pull and regularly lift 25 lbs., and occasionally lift 50 lbs.
* Ability to work with fresh, dried and/or processed products, spices and powdered substances without negative allergic consequences.
* Ability to tolerate dust and cleaning agents during routine housekeeping duties.
* Ability to work in varying temperatures.
* Ability to stand for long periods of time.
* Ability to interact with customers in a friendly and helpful way.
* Ability to work cooperatively with others.
* Return items to the proper place.

**Job Functions:**

Performance of the essential functions of this position requires the team member to possess the minimum qualifications listed above. These functions include, but are not limited to, the following:

* Maintain a clean, neat, organized and safe work environment.
* Clean and sanitize all work surfaces, utensils, and equipment in accordance with Department of Sanitation and QA standards.
* Keep the floor clear of debris and spills.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Local, State and Federal regulations as they pertain to the Front-End operation.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Company rules, policies, safety requirements, and security standards, and all Local, State and Federal health and civil code regulations.
* Perform duties in accordance with hand washing standards and use disposable gloves when handling unpackaged foods.
* Greet all customers and provide them with prompt, courteous service and assistance.
* Understand the operation of the cash register and follow all cash handling procedures.
* Accurately identify and scan products under the correct department (when necessary).
* Regularly lift, pull, push and rotate merchandise that weights 25 lbs. and that occasionally weights up to 50 lbs.
* Check prices and be knowledgeable about the location of items in the store.
* Accurately and quickly collect proper payment and provide proper change.
* Process all forms of payments (i.e., cash, credit, checks, EBT, WIC, Rain checks, coupons, vouchers, gift cards, etc) in accordance with Company guidelines.
* Promote for sale of any current charitable promotions to customers.
* Properly bag customer’s orders safely and efficiently.
* Handle damaged or return-to-stock products according to Company policy, with priority attention is given to refrigerated, perishable items, and sell by date.
* Recognize and be knowledgeable about various types of products carried in the store, including produce items.
* Understand and adhere to Company shrink guidelines as relates to Front-End operations.
* Perform duties in accordance with the Company’s program and adhere to the manufacturer’s label instructions for the safe and proper use of all chemical products.
* Utilize and maintain equipment as required by department; report any equipment problems immediately.
* Complete all applicable department training programs.
* Work cooperatively with others.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 35 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift

Ability to Commute:

* Bronx, NY 10462 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Assistant Guest Services Manager
description:
**Company Description** **Why work for Accor?**  

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.


By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/


Be a part of the historic castle on the park, The Plaza, A Fairmont Managed hotel, a timeless landmark capturing memories since 1907. Located in the heart of midtown, The Plaza now features 282 luxury hotel rooms and suites, the elegant Champagne Bar as well as the legendary Palm Court, New York City’s premier destination for afternoon tea. The Plaza offers the Five Diamond standard of excellence and sophistication while offering an authentically local and unrivalled experience for our guest.

Providing engaging, sincere, personalized service is one of the ways our Front Office Colleagues and Leaders are turning moments into memories for our guests at Fairmont Hotels & Resorts. Showcase your interpersonal strengths as Assistant Guest Services Manager, where you will lead, train and recognize your team in support of exceptional guest service!

**Salary Range:** $70,000 to $74,000 annually, depending on experience

**Summary of Responsibilities:**  

Reporting to the Guest Services Manager, responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

* Consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service

* Ability to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**Visa Requirements:** Must be legally authorized to work in the United States.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Now more than ever, companies are focused on their bottom line. Tropic's AI-powered Intelligent Spend Management platform automates procurement to give companies like OpenAI, Notion, and Zapier maximum leverage to control costs and reduce spend.



We launched from stealth in 2020, raised $65 million in funding from tier 1 investors like Insight Partners, became a LinkedIn Top Startup, and rapidly grew to $10B+ in spend under management for our customers. Now is the perfect time to join. The best is yet to come!

### **Location(s)**



We are looking to hire someone based in the United States for this position.


### **About the Role**



We are seeking a results-driven Digital Marketing Manager with 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing for SaaS companies. In this role, you will be responsible for optimizing and executing our digital marketing strategies across paid search, paid social, SEO, and our website to drive awareness, engagement, and conversions among our target audiences. We're looking for someone with a creative yet analytical mind, who has a passion for measuring data. The ideal candidate is someone with a deep knowledge of paid digital and SEO best practices who can proactively identify opportunities for optimization across our website and paid campaigns, to help us attract and convert pipeline.


### **What You'll Do**


* **Digital Campaign Management:** Lead the execution and optimization of digital marketing programs across paid search, paid social, and display advertising platforms, ensuring alignment with overall marketing goals.
* **SEO Strategy & Execution:** Oversee and enhance our SEO strategy, working closely with our digital agency to drive organic search performance. Collaborate with the content and design teams to optimize key landing pages for maximum conversions.
* **Website Management:** Manage the performance and optimization of our website, ensuring it is aligned with best practices for user experience (UX) and conversion rate optimization (CRO). Work closely with developers and designers to implement necessary improvements.
* **Data Analysis & Reporting:** Conduct in-depth analysis of paid campaigns, SEO and website performance using tools like Google Analytics 4 (GA4). Identify trends, insights, and opportunities for optimization, and present actionable recommendations to stakeholders.
* **A/B Testing:** Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to optimize digital marketing performance, including ad creatives, landing pages, and user experiences.
* **Agency Management:** Act as the primary liaison with our digital agency, ensuring that our paid search and SEO programs are delivering strong ROI and meeting agreed-upon KPIs.
* **Trend Monitoring & Implementation:** Stay up to date with the latest digital marketing trends and technologies, proactively identifying opportunities to implement new strategies that drive results.

### **What You've Done**


* 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing, specifically within SaaS companies.
* Strong expertise in managing and optimizing paid search (Google Ads), paid social (LinkedIn, Facebook), and SEO programs.
* Proven experience in conversion rate optimization (CRO) and website management.
* Advanced proficiency with GA4, SEO tools, and other analytics platforms.
* Demonstrated ability to analyze data, derive actionable insights and implement supporting optimizations.
* Experience managing digital marketing agencies and working collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* A proactive, data-driven approach to identifying and implementing optimization opportunities.

### **Compensation**



Specific to pay transparency laws, the salary range starts at **$120,000** and may include commission, incentive pay, incentive stock options, and benefits. The final job level and compensation will be determined by factors such as a candidate's relevant work experience, years of relevant experience, skills, qualifications, certifications, geographic location, and other business considerations.

### **What We Offer**


* 100% medical, dental, & vision coverage for all employees + dependents
* Remote first work environment
* Optional offices in NYC and Denver
* Virtual & in-person meetups
* $1000 annual stipend for WFH, L&D, Wellness
* Unlimited flexible vacation and holiday time off
* 14 paid company holidays
* 12-week parental leave for all parents
* Online mental health therapy
* Commuter benefits, FSA, HSA
* Award-winning values and culture
* Equity refresh program
* 401k plan


Research suggests that 60% of those identifying as under-represented might have talked themselves out of applying due to imposter syndrome or the confidence gap. If this applies to you, feel empowered to apply for this role even if your experience doesn't exactly match up to our job description (our job descriptions are directional and not perfect recipes for exactly what we need).



Tropic is an equal opportunity employer that supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity/expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class. Tropic is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.

title: Aircraft Fueler (Line Service) (2-10 pm) at Private Airport in Wall Township!
description:
**Job Title:** Line Service Technician

We are a PRIVATE JET airport!~

Located at Monmouth Executive Airport in Wall Township, NJ !

**Position for those seeking a career, not a job!**

**Job Title:** Aviation Service Technician

We are a privately owned, public use jet airport! If aviation is your passion and you want to step into the industry this is the perfect position.

Frequently called a Line Service Technician (LST), an Aviation Service Technician is the first line of customer interface at an airport. You will deal with both pilots and customers on a daily basis.

Our perfect team member is outgoing, self-driven, eager to learn and looking to get involved in a niche industry that will keep you employed the rest of your life.

Must be comfortable with working outdoors and in all weather conditions.

Experience is preferred but not required as complete training will be provided to the right candidate.

Line Service Technicians work with fuels as well as ground support equipment. Procedures must be followed at all times for your personal safety as well as the safety of other employees, customers, aircraft and equipment. You will be working in a high-noise environment and the use of hearing protection, provided by the company, is required at all times.

A valid driver’s license/clean driving record and High School Diploma or equivalent (GED) is required. Must be at least 18 years old per New Jersey Labor Laws to work with aviation fuel.

**Duties and Responsibilities:** 

- Fuel aircraft

- Tow and marshal (guide) aircraft

- Ensure aircraft are chocked, locked and secure

- Aircraft lavatory and potable water service

- Load/unload baggage

- Assist pilots with aircraft pre and post flight services

- Top off fuel trucks and fill out proper fuel farm paperwork

- Operate ground support equipment

- Provide basic security to people and property

- Direct people, drivers, and flight crews on ramp area

- Other tasks as required

Physical Requirements:

- Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds above head

- Stepping up/down on ladders, tugs, and fuel trucks

- Bending and stooping to pick up tow bars and other equipment as well as chock aircraft

- Lift baggage from ground level to waist and overhead while loading aircraft

- Good hand-eye coordination and good peripheral vision

- Ability to work without direct management supervision.

Starting wage: $17.50

Experience: Pay commensurate with experience

Full Time employees are offered health insurance, 10 vacation days, 5 sick days, 2 personal days, as well as 9 paid holidays per year

Pay: $17.50 up depending on experience

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)

* Paid time off
* 9 Paid Holidays

* Day shift
* Weekends as needed

title: Trading Intern
description:
Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 20 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda has offices in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.


Garda is looking to hire an intern to join the Commodity trading team in New York. The candidate will be supporting portfolio managers, helping implement solutions for our trading and risk systems. In the course of the internship, you will be exposed to the analytics used in trading, working closely with a mentor who will provide guidance and feedback.


**Position Responsibilities**


* Support portfolio managers by improving trading and risk spreadsheets and systems
* Assist in the development of screeners and trading signals to complement investment decisions
* Support the team's research process, including data collection and analysis, prototyping, backtesting, and performance monitoring


**Qualifications & Desired Skills**


* Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in statistics, financial engineering, applied math, finance, computer science, or similar quantitative or technical discipline
* Exceptional quantitative & programming skills (Python & SQL)
* Knowledge and interest in financial markets
* Ability to work effectively in a high-energy, time-sensitive team environment
* Strong communication skills
* Detail-oriented nature with strong verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to work independently
* Intellectual curiosity and motivation to innovate and improve

title: Health Home Care Manager (NYC, NY / Field-based)
description:
Started in 2016, FreedomCare is a Healthcare company that is innovating and revolutionizing the way home care is delivered. We bring dignity and support to patients needing care in their homes and to the caregivers who care for them. We're the largest consumer-directed home care agency in NY State and are continually expanding our areas of focus including operations in other states and tech-based innovations.



We pride ourselves on our values which drive the level of care that we deliver to our patients:


* Here For You (An attitude of service, empathy, and availability)
* Own It (Drive and ownership)
* Do the Right Thing (High integrity)
* Be Positive (Great attitude and a can-do positive approach to challenges)


Join our team and make a positive impact on the lives of others! We are looking for a Health Home Care Managerfor our Care Management team.


*It is required of this position to travel to patients' homes in the boroughs of Manhattan, Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens. Possible travel to Statent Island.*


**Department & Position Overview:**



The Health Home Care Manager will work to outreach and engage potentially eligible patients and obtain appropriate consents to enroll the patient in the Health Home Care Management Program. Once the patient is enrolled, the Health Home Care Manager will work collaboratively with the patient's care team to complete a comprehensive assessment and patient centered care plan, and to coordinate care based on the care plan.


**Every Day You Will:**


* Screen for Health Home functional scale eligibility, conduct initial Health Homes assessments and reassessments of patient needs, including medical, mental health, substance use, financial, housing, and additional support needs
* Collaborate with the medical providers and patients to develop, implement, and coordinate Health Homes compliant care plans for patients with chronic diseases, such as diabetes, asthma, congestive heart failure, hypertension, mental health conditions, substance use, and more and document care plan outcomes
* Provide direct service to a caseload of chronically ill patients and help them achieve their care plan goals by facilitating referrals, addressing access issues, connecting them to local resources, and developing relationships with healthcare providers
* Coordinate patient services and care with pharmacies, insurance companies, hospital discharge planning, family caregivers, and other providers
* Provide crisis intervention when needed
* Conduct home visits and maintain patient contact and documentation of all services in accordance with Health Homes standards
* Maintain patient confidentiality at all times


**Ideal Candidate Will Possess:**


* Bachelor's Degree (Required)
* 2 years of Care Management experience
* Ability to travel in the field to accompany patients to appointments and meet patients in person when needed
* Strong working knowledge of local community resources
* Demonstrated ability to work with data reporting, documentation, and outcomes
* Strong communication and assessment skills; the ability to relate to patients, their families, and community care providers, along with ability to handle rapidly changing crisis situations
* Ability to manage high volume caseloads
* Able to express empathy and compassion for the underserved
* Experience navigating several data management systems, such as Salesforce


**Nice-to-Haves:**


* Master's Degree is a plus
* Bilingual Spanish strongly preferred
* Ability to travel to all 5 boroughs in the NYC area

  


**Why work at FreedomCare?**



We are here for you and committed to providing a best-in-class employee experience. We offer competitive compensation, medical benefits, retirement plans, wellness programs, fun company events and ongoing learning opportunities to grow your career.



This is a place where your voice matters, where we build great relationships, and your work has meaning and a tangible positive impact on others!

  


*At FreedomCare, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, citizenship or immigration status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.*
